title: I was appointed to the United States Air Force Academy, what kind of aerospace engineering degree can I expect to receive there? - Quora

response.answer_text: You cannot earn a degree in aerospace engineering at USAFA. You’ll have to choose between aeronautical and astronautical engineering. This distinction alone is an indicator of the extra depth you’ll get in your chosen discipline compared to many other programs. I graduated (barely) with an Astro degree in 2004. I took a few Masters level Astro classes at CSULB while I was working in El Segundo, and I was shocked at what I experienced. The undergraduate Astro program at USAFA was basically the same material as the 500 courses at Long Beach, but the Long. Each program was inferior in every aspect (professors, class size, labs, intelligence of classmates, etc…). The USAFA program is world class. Ten years ago, the USAFA Astro degree was more unique than it is today. There are other equally strong programs at USC, UT, Georgia Tech, and I assume others. Don’t go to USAFA for the degree. Go there if you’re called to serve and get the amazing degree while you’re at it (and for free)

The best the world has to offer. There is no better bachelor’s degree in AE anywhere on earth. And then you get to go do it. The US Air Force is the absolute pinnacle of the craft. At some point you may want a graduate degree, which is where those second tier schools like MIT and Cal Tech might come in. Good luck! Scott Welker Class of 1984
